thread.title: Do wind turbines use up all the wind?
thread.title_full: Do wind turbines use up all the wind?

author: Clay Thompson
title: Do wind turbines use up all the wind?
text:
Going to and from San Diego we pass large fields of wind turbines. If we put up enough of them in one spot, does it deplete the power of the winds in those passes?
This is sort of a hazy area. We wouldn’t know for sure until wind farms cover a much greater area than they do today.
However, according to a “Scientific American” article from Feb.14, 2014, researchers have found those turbines when concentrated in a small area possibly can have an effect on the rainfall and temperatures . The study said researchers at a Texas wind farm found there was some warming in overnight temperatures, but only in the immediate area of the turbines.
